dt: {bc}a woman who becomes pregnant by artificial insemination or by implantation of a fertilized egg created by in vitro fertilization for the purpose of carrying the fetus to term for another person or persons

dt.t: Live births by {wi}surrogate mothers{/wi} were up more than 160 percent from 2004 to 2013, to 1,939, according to the American Society for Reproductive Medicine.
A {wi}surrogate mother{/wi} has given birth to quadruplets, who will be raised by their natural father and his male domestic partner.

Evidence suggests that US military wives are increasingly targeted as desirable {wi}surrogate mothers{/wi}; they are generally low to-middle-income, stay-at-home mothers with high-quality, government-sponsored health care and few employment options of their own …

dt: {bc}a female animal that is impregnated (as by {d_link|embryo transfer|embryo transfer} or artificial insemination) in order to bear young in place of another animal

dt.t: Farmers administer fertility drugs to prize cows and then artificially inseminate them. A week later, experts flush out fertilized embryos and freeze them until they're sold for implantation in {wi}surrogate mothers{/wi}.

The mare was only a {wi}surrogate mother{/wi}; the zebra embryo, fertilized normally a year ago Wednesday, was implanted in the mare's womb last May by Dr. Bill Foster …. This was the first known instance of a horse giving birth to a full-blooded zebra, according to zoo officials.

dt: {bc}one who acts or serves as a substitute mother

dt.t: In Gimme a Break! in the early 1980s, Nell Carter played a live-in housekeeper to a widowed white police officer (Dolph Sweet), and became essentially a {wi}surrogate mother{/wi} to his children.
Typically, Nick managed to attract the sympathy of a {wi}surrogate mother{/wi}—albeit a crusty one. When he showed up on the Solution set an hour late, [Katherine] Hepburn … gave him a lecture.

Part of the credit for their success goes to a large stuffed Snoopy dog, which became the young chick's {wi}surrogate mother{/wi}, says Frank Todd, corporate curator of birds at Sea World. Emperor chicks in the wild nestle on the feet of their mothers, and researchers had reasoned that the toy animal would provide similar security.

utxt.t: Advocates of {wi}surrogate motherhood{/wi} say that private arrangements between individuals are part of a guaranteed right to bear children without interference from the state.
